mdRecord.dcterms:title: Hemoglobinometer
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Rieker Instrument Company
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Contained in a leather care; set includes: hemoglobinometer device, plastic attachment, lens, wax and string, candle holder. Inside sticker reads: "This certifies that Dare Hemoglobinometer No. 5199 has been examined and approved." Sticker is signed by Arthur Dare and dated February 19, 1920. Imprint in faded gold reads: "The Dare Hemoglobinometer, Made by Rieker Instrument Co., 1919-1921 Fairmont Ave. Philadelphia, Pa. U.S.A." Graded 90-100.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments and apparatus
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
